questions.question: 1. What is the primary factor that determines the width of a single-slit diffraction pattern?

answers.c: Distance between the slit and the screen

questions.question: 2.In a single-slit diffraction pattern, where would you observe the brightest central maximum?

answers.a: At the center of the screen
answers.d: At the edges of the screen

questions.question: 3. How does the width of the single-slit diffraction pattern change when the wavelength of the incident light increases?

answers.d: It is not affected by the wavelength

questions.question: 4. What is the relationship between the width of the single-slit diffraction pattern and the width of the slit?

answers.d: The relationship depends on the wavelength

questions.question: 5. Which of the following statements is true regarding the single-slit diffraction pattern?

answers.a: The central maximum is always wider than the secondary maxima.
answers.b: The central maximum is always narrower than the secondary maxima.
answers.c: The central maximum and secondary maxima have the same width.
answers.d: The width of the central maximum and secondary maxima depends on the material of the slit.
